result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus Shegonee Dixon-Seidl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marcus Shegonee Dixon-Seidl in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties. 
Defendant ordered to serve 5 months in the House of Correction.  Huber Privileges for work and treatment.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:
*No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

15RM031620  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-18-15

Defendant Marcus Shegonee Dixon-Seidl in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defendant that he now qualifies for Public Defender representation.  Case adjourned for status of counsel to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marcus Shegonee Dixon-Seidl in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 06-25-2015 at 01:30pm
